Key Match Events: India's pacers, led by Arshdeep Singh, Mohammed Siraj, Jasprit Bumrah, and Hardik Pandya, ripped through Ireland's line-up, with Bumrah returning to finish the innings with a pinpoint yorker to tailender Josh Little.
Ireland's only notable contribution came from Gareth Delany (26, 14b, 2x4, 2x6) who adopted an aggressive approach.
Post-Match Reflections: India's captain Rohit Sharma reached his 30th T20I fifty before retiring hurt due to an injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Indian fans, who made up the majority of the crowd, left the stadium happy.
Others: The Nassau County International Cricket Stadium surface offered uneven bounce and exaggerated movement, making runs difficult for both teams.
